message_1: Suppose a vending machine dispenses a can of soda every 20 seconds. Using temporal logic, write a formula to express the statement "Every 2 minutes, 6 cans of soda are dispensed."
message_2:
Let P(t) represent the proposition "a can of soda is dispensed at time t." We want to express that every 2 minutes (120 seconds), 6 cans of soda are dispensed. We can write this using temporal logic as follows:

∀t : (t mod 120 = 0) → (P(t) ∧ P(t+20) ∧ P(t+40) ∧ P(t+60) ∧ P(t+80) ∧ P(t+100))
